terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Standard Operating Procedures - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks consistently and safely
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, ensuring teams always access the latest version
A single, unified location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed for easy access and organization
A software platform that organizes, stores, and controls access to documents and information within an organization
Software or services that are hosted on remote servers and accessed through the internet rather than installed locally
The ability for multiple users to work on and edit documents simultaneously with instant updates visible to all participants
The optimization of business processes to reduce time, effort, and resources while maintaining or improving output quality
Records and documents that demonstrate adherence to industry regulations, standards, and legal requirements
An international standard that specifies requirements for quality management systems in organizations
An electronic system for storing, organizing, and retrieving digital documents and data
A system that automatically tracks, manages, and updates document versions without manual intervention
Key Performance Indicators - measurable values that demonstrate how effectively an organization is achieving key business objectives
Occupational Safety and Health Administration - a U.S. federal agency that enforces workplace safety and health regulations
